page.title: 20Ecology-Dymchurch Beach
page.content: The beach is sandy with large blocks of stone under the sea wall.The few pebbles have been gradually pushed by currents from West of Dungeness.Gran- ite & sandstone are the most common pebbles.Smoothed glass,brick,coal & cuttlebone are easy to find.No seaweed grows in the sea by Dymchurch because the water is too shallow.Breakers are placed at regular intervals to check the force of the waves on the sea wall.Many forms of sea life are found in little pools:crab,lugworm,weaver- fish,dabs,flounder,sand-eels & shrimps.There are a few jellyfish.Com- mon whelk,dog whelk,razorshell,peri- winkle & cockle are shells commonly found on the beach.There are few lim- pets,but many barnacles on break- waters.Flotsam & jetsam on the tide- line include plastic bottles,orange- peel,oil cans & polystirene cups.
